Excellent plan! You're taking a thorough and organized approach to researching your great-grandfather's antique clock collection. By utilizing the National Association of Watch and Clock Collectors website and the Clock Collectors Forum, you'll have access to a wealth of knowledge and resources from experts and enthusiasts in the field.

Reaching out to local clock dealers and collectors in the area where your great-grandfather lived is a great idea, as they may have knowledge about the clocks or have come across similar pieces in their inventory. They may also be able to provide valuable insights or point you in the right direction.

Asking your family members about the clocks is also crucial, as they may have personal memories or stories about the clocks that can help you piece together their history. Photos and documents related to the clocks can also provide valuable provenance and help you better understand the clocks' significance.

Remember to keep detailed records of your research, including notes, photos, and any correspondence with experts or family members. This will help you keep track of your progress and ensure that you don't miss any important information.

Some additional tips to consider:

* Be respectful and open-minded when reaching out to experts and family members. They may have valuable information or insights that can help you, but they may also have their own stories or biases that can inform your research.
* Don't be afraid to ask questions or seek clarification when you're unsure about something. The clock collecting community is known for being knowledgeable and enthusiastic, and many experts are happy to share their expertise with others.
* Consider creating a timeline or family tree to help you keep track of the clocks' history and ownership. This can be a useful tool for visualizing the clocks' journey and identifying any gaps in your knowledge.

By following these steps, you'll be well on your way to uncovering the history and significance of your great-grandfather's antique clock collection. Good luck, and I hope you make some exciting discoveries along the way!
